title: Show HN: Create a paid link to anything
“Laws” of software estimation for complex work (2021)
dot: digraph G{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightgray, fontname="Helvetica, Arial"];subgraph cluster_main_idea{label="Main Concept";style=dashed;concept1[label="Unrealistic Software Estimates", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightyellow];concept2[label="C-level Estimation Without Teams", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightyellow];concept3[label="Imposing Deadlines = Disaster", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightyellow];concept4[label="Ineffective Communication and Understanding", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightyellow];concept5[label="The Flawed Gambler’s Fallacy in Estimation", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightyellow];}subgraph cluster_laws{label="11 Laws of Software Estimation";style=dotted;law1[label="1. The work takes the same time, no matter the estimate.", shape=box];law2[label="2. Estimates are guesses, never fully trusted.", shape=box];law3[label="3. Imposing estimates on others creates disaster.", shape=box];law4[label="4. Estimates become more reliable as the project progresses.", shape=box];law5[label="5. Worrying about estimates distracts from important tasks.", shape=box];law6[label="6. Strong teams give mediocre estimates.", shape=box];law7[label="7. The value of estimates is common understanding, not accuracy.", shape=box];law8[label="8. Simplicity improves estimate accuracy.", shape=box];law9[label="9. Doing the work increases estimate accuracy.", shape=box];law10[label="10. Breaking down work too much delays the project.", shape=box];law11[label="11. Punishing bad estimates demotivates the team.", shape=box];}concept1->{law1 law2 law3 law4 law5};concept2->{law6 law7 law8 law9};concept3->{law10 law11};concept4->{law7 law6};concept5->law2;image1[label="Image of Crystal Ball Estimation", shape=rect, style=dotted, width=1.5];image2[label="Image of Team Discussion and Collaboration", shape=rect, style=dotted, width=1.5]; concept1->image1;concept4->image2;rankdir=LR;fontsize=10;}
